New Records: Alex Hales scored 86 runs off 47 balls, the highest score in the match.
Jos Buttler scored 80 runs off 49 balls, the second-highest score.
Key Match Events: England won the match by 10 wickets with 24 balls remaining.
Alex Hales and Jos Buttler scored heavily, with Hales contributing 86 runs and Buttler 80 runs.
India lost six wickets for 168 runs, while England lost none and finished on 170/0.
Pre-Game Insights: England won the toss and elected to field first.
The match was played at the Adelaide Oval as part of the ICC Men's T20 World Cup.
England's players, including Alex Hales and Jos Buttler, were expected to perform well.
Post-Match Reflections: Alex Hales was named Player of the Match for his impressive batting performance.
England advanced to the next stage of the tournament with this victory.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match saw a high-scoring contest with England finishing with a strong total.
The umpires included Kumar Dharmasena, Paul Reiffel, and Chris Gaffaney.
Others: The match was the 1878th T20I, and it was held on November 10, 2022.
